result.execSummary:
The defendant David E Derler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.
-----------------------------------
*CORRECTION-  10/31/2016 - Corrected to mark eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program (CIP) and Substance Abuse Program (SAP).
If probation is revoked, conditions of extended supervision shall be the same as conditions of probation.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs including Department of Corrections supervision fees.  **NOTE:  THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.  Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
------------------------------

No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  No prescription medication without a valid prescription.  Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  No contact with Amber Lazowski or her children.
------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  Continue to comply with his current treatment program.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.  Reimburse buy money to the Walworth County Drug Unit in the amount of $150.
When released from jail, find and maintain full time employment or school or a combination of the two.

timeConds.notes: commencing on or before October 13, 2016, at 8:00 a.m. with work release ONLY for treatment appointments under the current treatment regimen he is receiving.  Conditional jail time may be served in Kenosha County, but defendant may only be released for his treatment appointments under the current treatment regimen that he is receiving.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David E Derler

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Pro Se Motion Granted - other
Pro Se Motion sent to Judge for response -Other (Medication pick-up)
Amended Temporary Commitment form filed
Temporary Commitment form filed
BOND QUASHED

11:15 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Spec. Pros. Zeke S. Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David E Derler in court with attorney Stephen M Compton.  
Matter is before the Court for sentencing.  Court recites charge and maximum potential penalties.  Court has reviewed contents of file including the PSI and the Defendant's Sentencing memorandum.  
11:17 am  Atty Compton has reviewed the PSI with Mr. Derler and he has some corrections.  
11:19 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Wiedenfeld.  11:30 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Compton.  
11:46 am  Statement by Daniel Derler on behalf of his brother.  11:51 am  Statement by Defendant.  
11:57 am  Response by Defendant to Court's questions.  
11:57 am  Court proceeds with making its record and sentencing the Defendant.  

SENTENCE:  
3 yrs IC + 3 yrs ES = 6 yrs - IMPOSED AND STAYED;  
Eligible for both CIP and SAP;  
7 days sentence credit if probation is revoked;  
--------  
Five (5) years probation;  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Six (6) months in the Walworth County Jail  to commence on October 13, 2016 with work release ONLY for his treatment appointments under the current treatment regime he is receiving.  Conditional Jail time can be served in Kenosha County but defendant may only be released for his treatment appointments under the current treatment regime that he is receiving.    
1)  Continue to comply with his current treatment program.  
2)  Engage in any counseling as recommended.  
3)  Reimburse buy money to Walworth County Drug Unit in the amount of $150.00.  
4)  Pay court costs and DOC supervision fees.  
5)  No alcohol.  No drugs or drug paraphernalia.  No prescription medication without a valid prescription.  
6)  Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.  
7)  No contact with Amber Lazowski or her children.  
8)  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  
9)  When released from jail, find and maintain full time employment or school or a combination of the two.  

Court gives warnings as to:  1) Firearm restriction;  2) Ineligibility to vote;  12:15 pm  Court in recess.
Sentencing Memorandum

Defendant David E Derler in court with attorney Stephen M Compton.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant David E Derler in court with attorney Stephen M Compton.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Not guilty plea and trial reserved. Motion deadline prior to status on 02-15-2016

Defendant David E Derler in court with attorney Stephen M Compton.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter before the Court for preliminary hearing, but defendant wishes to waive the hearing. Court goes over waiver form with the defendant. Information filed-reading waived.  Status conference scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money
Signed bond filed with the court.
Atty Stephen Compton

MUST POST $1000.00 CASH
Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH A.L. OR CI 1148.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
SEE SIGNATURE BOND FOR CONDITIONS
